name: Speakerfile
tag_list: speakers, event-organizers, meeting-planners, social-networking, speaking-engagements, professional-speakers, corporate-speakers, public-speaking, conferences, keynote, seminar, workshop, leader, thought-leader, mc, host, moderator, panel, panelist
description: The Global Source for Thought Leaders
overview:
Launched in 2011, Speakerfile is an expert marketplace to list, discover, and book speaking engagements around the world. Whether you are looking to book a speaker for your next event, or looking for an event to speak at, Speakerfile now makes these connections possible via detailed, searchable rich-media profiles complete with connection and booking features. It’s a lot like eHarmony for experts and events.

Speakerfile’s diverse network of speakers spans over 60 countries, covering hundreds of industries and thousands of speaking topics. It’s now the fastest growing online network of corporate and professional speakers. Speakerfile focuses on harder to find corporate speakers who are experts in their field who speak on panels and also do workshops, not just keynotes. It’s perfect for industry associations and smaller regional conferences who want access talented speakers who don’t have representation from a speakers bureau.

Now organizations can showcase their experts & thought leaders using Speakerfile to publish richer, more dynamic content in a branded speaker site. Advanced publishing and third-party administrative (agent) features make the Speakerfile platform perfect for both marketing departments and agencies. Unique to Speakerfile is an advanced events listing feature where event organizers can publish detailed open-call requests for speakers down to the session level and evaluate speakers on key criteria. Media are also encouraged to use the application to discover fresh expert sources for their next article or interview.

The service is offered free of charge for event organizers & media and Speakerfile does not charge commissions on any speaking fees. The service is supported through corporate and agency subscriptions that it charges for its premium features.
